definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)

sentences.english: When you first start learning to drive a stick shift car, don't do it on any kind of a hill.
sentences.chinese: 當您剛開始學習駕駛手動擋時，千萬別嘗試任何坡道。

sentences.english: This trick is mainly about manual gear.
sentences.chinese: 這個竅門主要是關於手動擋車型的。

sentences.english: Driving a manual transmission is more about learning the principle of how to use the different parts.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛手動擋汽車，主要是學習如何使用不同的部件。

sentences.english: Apply for a driving manual transmission cars, limb length no larger than 5 cm.
sentences.chinese: 申請駕駛手動擋汽車，下肢不等長度不得大於5釐米。

sentences.english: For the applicants for driving MT car, the discrepancy of length between two limbs shall not be more than 5cm.
sentences.chinese: 申請駕駛手動擋汽車，下肢不等長度不得大於5釐米。

sentences.english: I'm looking for a sports car.
sentences.chinese: 你的汽車想配備一個手動擋還是自動擋？

sentences.english: Do you want manual or automatic transmission?
sentences.chinese: 你的汽車想配備一個手動擋還是自動擋？

sentences.english: I can't drive a stick. Do you have any automatics?
sentences.chinese: 我不會開手動擋的車。你有自動擋的嗎？
